He is now slated to continue the joy of his life for all eternity.Although his new form includes a number of large razor-sharp blades growing from his demonic appendages, he kept his favourite axe and is eager to let you test its edge. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Ignacio** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") [executioner](/Executioner "Executioner") of [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb") with much more HP than normal, as well as an [executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") of [pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)"). He can deal an insane amount of damage in melee, especially when hasted. A rare unique, he only exists in 50% of games, and if he does generate, will only be found on random floors in [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"). If you flee the particular level of Pandemonium you found him on without killing him, he will appear in later Pan levels with a 10% chance.

## Location

- [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium")

## Spells

| Spell set I |                         |                                                      |
| :---------- | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Agony](/Agony "Agony") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Haste](/Haste "Haste") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Make sure to have at least one level of [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") resistance to reduce the damage of Agony and his pain-branded axe. rN+++ is good to have if you can pull it off.
- Don't expect an army of summoned allies to keep Ignacio away from you; his [cleaving](/Cleaving "Cleaving") attacks allow him to clear away anything adjacent to him very quickly.
- Like any executioner, he cannot fly, but good luck finding any [lava](/Lava "Lava") or [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") to trap him behind.
- With Ignacio, there really is no such thing as overkill - allowing him into melee range is suicidal for all but the most heavily-armored characters, and even they may find themselves taking frightening amounts of damage. Hit him with everything you have as quickly as possible.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), collecting pandemonium runes increased the chance to find Ignacio on a pandemonium floor.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Ignacio could cast [Pain](/Pain "Pain").
html:
Ignacio

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Ignacio 1 
HP 166-336
HD 18
XP 6732
Speed 20
AC 10
EV 15
Will 160
Attack1 20 (hit: plain)
Attack2 10 (hit: plain)
Attack3 10 (hit: plain)
Attack4 5 (hit: plain)
Resistances rF+
rC+
rElec
rPois+
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Silver
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Demonic
Size Large
Type Executioner, Executioner
Flags Fighter

See invisible
Speaks
Unique
Male
While a mortal cannot turn into a demon aside from divine intervention, this is what happened to Ignacio after Makhleb saw his love for his job and smiled upon him. He is now slated to continue the joy of his life for all eternity.

Although his new form includes a number of large razor-sharp blades growing from his demonic appendages, he kept his favourite axe and is eager to let you test its edge.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Ignacio is a unique executioner of Makhleb with much more HP than normal, as well as an executioner's axe of pain. He can deal an insane amount of damage in melee, especially when hasted. A rare unique, he only exists in 50% of games, and if he does generate, will only be found on random floors in Pandemonium. If you flee the particular level of Pandemonium you found him on without killing him, he will appear in later Pan levels with a 10% chance.

Location

  • Pandemonium

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Agony Magical flag
Slot2 Haste Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Make sure to have at least one level of negative energy resistance to reduce the damage of Agony and his pain-branded axe. rN+++ is good to have if you can pull it off.
  • Don't expect an army of summoned allies to keep Ignacio away from you; his cleaving attacks allow him to clear away anything adjacent to him very quickly.
  • Like any executioner, he cannot fly, but good luck finding any lava or deep water to trap him behind.
  • With Ignacio, there really is no such thing as overkill - allowing him into melee range is suicidal for all but the most heavily-armored characters, and even they may find themselves taking frightening amounts of damage. Hit him with everything you have as quickly as possible.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, collecting pandemonium runes increased the chance to find Ignacio on a pandemonium floor.
  • Prior to 0.19, Ignacio could cast Pain.

{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Ignacio''' is a [[unique]] [[executioner]] of [[Makhleb]] with much more HP than normal, as well as an [[executioner's axe]] of [[Pain (brand)|pain]]. He can deal an insane amount of damage in melee, especially when hasted. A rare unique, he only exists in 50% of games, and if he does generate, will only be found on random floors in [[Pandemonium]]. If you flee the particular level of Pandemonium you found him on without killing him, he will appear in later Pan levels with a 10% chance.

==Location==
*[[Pandemonium]]

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Make sure to have at least one level of [[negative energy]] resistance to reduce the damage of Agony and his pain-branded axe. rN+++ is good to have if you can pull it off.
*Don't expect an army of summoned allies to keep Ignacio away from you; his [[cleaving]] attacks allow him to clear away anything adjacent to him very quickly.
*Like any executioner, he cannot fly, but good luck finding any [[lava]] or [[deep water]] to trap him behind.
*With Ignacio, there really is no such thing as overkill - allowing him into melee range is suicidal for all but the most heavily-armored characters, and even they may find themselves taking frightening amounts of damage. Hit him with everything you have as quickly as possible.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.30]], collecting pandemonium runes increased the chance to find Ignacio on a pandemonium floor.
*Prior to [[0.19]], Ignacio could cast [[Pain]].
